verses.kjv: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.
verses.ct: Don't be jealous of wicked people, and don't wish you could be part of their crowd.

verses.kjv: For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
verses.ct: Their minds are always plotting violence, and their words stir up trouble.

verses.kjv: Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:
verses.ct: A household is built through wisdom, and it becomes secure through understanding.

verses.kjv: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
verses.ct: Through knowledge, its rooms are filled with every kind of valuable and beautiful treasure.

verses.kjv: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
verses.ct: A wise person has great power, and someone with knowledge keeps growing stronger.

verses.kjv: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.
verses.ct: With good strategy you can wage your battles, and victory comes from having many advisors.

verses.kjv: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
verses.ct: Wisdom is out of reach for a fool — he has nothing to contribute when leaders gather at the city gate.

verses.kjv: He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.
verses.ct: Anyone who schemes to do wrong will earn a reputation as a troublemaker.

verses.kjv: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.
verses.ct: Foolish scheming is sin, and everyone despises a person who mocks others.

verses.kjv: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.
verses.ct: If you collapse under pressure when hard times come, your strength was never very great.

verses.kjv: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;
verses.ct: Rescue those who are being dragged off to die; hold back those who are stumbling toward slaughter.

verses.kjv: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?
verses.ct: If you say, 'We didn't know about this,' doesn't the one who examines your heart see the truth? Doesn't the one who watches over your soul know? And won't he repay each person based on what they've done?

verses.kjv: My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:
verses.ct: My son, eat honey because it's good; the honeycomb is sweet on your tongue.

verses.kjv: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
verses.ct: In the same way, wisdom is sweet to your soul. If you find it, you'll have a future, and your hope won't be disappointed.

verses.kjv: Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:
verses.ct: Don't lurk like a criminal near the home of a righteous person; don't raid the place where he lives.

verses.kjv: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.
verses.ct: A righteous person may fall 7 times, but he gets back up each time — while the wicked are brought down by disaster.

verses.kjv: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:
verses.ct: Don't celebrate when your enemy falls, and don't let your heart be happy when he stumbles.

verses.kjv: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
verses.ct: Otherwise the LORD might see it and be displeased, and he might redirect his anger away from your enemy.

verses.kjv: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;
verses.ct: Don't get worked up over evil people, and don't be envious of the wicked.

verses.kjv: For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.ct: The evil person has no future; the lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out.

verses.kjv: My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:
verses.ct: My son, deeply revere the LORD and respect the king. Don't get involved with people who are always stirring up rebellion.

verses.kjv: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?
verses.ct: Disaster will strike them without warning — and who knows what ruin both the LORD and the king can bring?

verses.kjv: These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
verses.ct: These sayings also come from the wise: Showing favoritism in legal decisions is wrong.

verses.kjv: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:
verses.ct: Whoever tells a guilty person, 'You're innocent' — the people will curse him, and nations will denounce him.

verses.kjv: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.
verses.ct: But those who hold the guilty accountable will prosper, and rich blessings will come to them.

verses.kjv: Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.
verses.ct: An honest, straightforward answer is like a kiss on the lips.

verses.kjv: Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.
verses.ct: Get your outdoor work organized and your fields ready first — then build your house afterward.

verses.kjv: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.
verses.ct: Don't testify against your neighbor without good reason, and don't use your words to deceive.

verses.kjv: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.
verses.ct: Don't say, 'I'll treat him exactly the way he treated me — I'll pay him back for what he did.'

verses.kjv: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
verses.ct: I walked past the field of a lazy person and by the vineyard of someone with no sense.

verses.kjv: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
verses.ct: The whole thing was overgrown with thorns, weeds covered the entire surface, and the stone wall had crumbled.

verses.kjv: Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.
verses.ct: I took a good look at it and thought carefully about what I saw — and I learned a lesson from it.

verses.kjv: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
verses.ct: 'Just a little more sleep, a little more rest, just folding my hands for a quick nap' —

verses.kjv: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.
verses.ct: and poverty will come at you like a drifter, and need will attack you like an armed robber.
